content: There's a lot to love about this but right now I have to give it to 2 stars and warn people that asyncronous play seems heavily bugged. I've played 1 online game live, despite minor issues viewing cards and the game state it did the job very well: it's a complex game and the app overall makes it very accessible. But when we played asynchronously there were issues starting each generation and then at the end for the final scoring none of us could log in! Days of play lost, no reply from support.

The good: the game is well implemented, jamming a lot of information into a small amount of screen space in a way that is easy to learn. The bad: everything else. Can't find friends unless they are literally in the app at the same time. In the recent update, I no longer get turn notifications. If you have multiple games going, there's no indication which game is your turn, so you load each, a ~30s process. If a game ends on someone else's turn while the app isn't open, you can't see who won!

The game is very buggy. For example, when playing timed games, there is no indicator to trust. Got kicked out of the game while still seeing 4 minutes remaining on my screen. Whenever I ask other players about how much time they see remaining for players, the numbers wildly vary. This is just one of many flaws in the game. I do still play it because the board game is great. But some other players refuse to play this implementation because it is so buggy.

Everything is great, except the AI. I have literally won every single game, and they've never even been close. There's no notable difference between easy and hard, and if makes solo play very boring. Otherwise it would have been the easiest 5 stars given.

content: Faithful translation of boardgame to the app version!

I love the board game, and the app has great potential, but the two games I've tried to play have both hung after a few turns, and on restarting, the progress has been lost. An autosave after each turn would be an obvious temporary fix, but these sort of game-breaking bugs need to be resolved urgently. Update: Seems to be more stable on my phone than my tablet, but still crashes occasionally. Also the time to load games is ridiculous! But the maid problem is that the game clearly hasn't been playtested by people that understand the board game. When reaching certain points on the terraforming tracks, you get a bonus. These do not trigger. Certain cards, such as Power Infrastructure are broken in this build, but were fixed on the computer version some time ago. Things like this would have been obvious on the very first play by anybody familiar with the source material and totally alter the way the game is supposed to work. Also the AI is dire. Even on Hard level, they make basic mistakes and always follow the same strategy, making for boring games. Simple examples include: they always spam aquifers and other standard projects, meaning that the game is rushed (less interesting for players who enjoy the engine-building aspect) but that the AIs rarely win. In almost all cases cards provide a cheaper way of increasing the global parameters and often provide an additional points bonus or other benefit. Standard Projects should be a last resort given how expensive they are. It's also clear that they have little randomness in their choices, as they always start building on the left hand side of the map, despite other valid choices being available. They don't consider the placement of greenarys so as not to provide good placements for opponent cities. Even really basic things such as selling any remaining cards on the final turn of the game (as money is a tiebreak) are not done. It's such a shame, because this is such a good game, and the fundamental implementation is quite good. But basic things not working, and an uninteresting AI challenge really drag it down. Looking forward to the patches.

content: Solid. Wish it had any of the expansions and the AI is pretty weak, particularly when drafting. Haven't tried out online.

Game works fine at it's core, but bugs and bad quality of life features hold the game back significantly. THE GOOD: It's Terraforming Mars on mobile and it works. Game is fun. THE BAD: You can't multitask with this game. If you switch to another app then switch back then the game restarts so it takes a minute to get back to what you were doing. Why? Never seen another mobile game like this. UI is slow and clunky. IDK if it's because of the 3D graphics but the game always feels a little laggy, especially when interacting with the board. No undo command. This is just ridiculous considering the game is designed so that opponents don't see your moves until you are done. There is no reason to not have an undo command except for dev laziness, and the clunky interface means that misclicking the board is easy to do when placing tiles. Friends list implementation is terrible (friends need to be online for you to add them). Async play doesn't work when drafting (everyone needs to be on at the same time during drafting). No expansion content. This game is simply not as good without Prelude and the extra boards. Implementing these expansions would make the game much better. UI for seeing cards is weak. Can only look at 4 cards at a time. Very hard to follow what your opponents are doing without constantly going to them and browsing through their played cards. The game needs to a find a way to show more info without having to open menus. Through The Ages is an example of a game perfectly implemented on mobile with a massive amount of polish. The devs should take notes from them. Terraforming Mars feels like it was thrown together quickly as a money grab. I'm glad the game at least works though. It's fun to play with a few friends or randoms if you're all online at the same time.

content: It's a good quality port of the boardgame. I like this version more than the PC version and it doesn't kill my phone battery like other games.
One of my top five board games. I own ever expansion even Kickstarted the newest one. Keep up the good work. Also make us another game need some else to play...
Good version of the board game, but I can't resume a game after closing the app. Hope this bug gets fixed.
A pretty good port of the actual board game. I'll always prefer the face to face, sit down at my table experience, but this does a very nice job of providing a solid gameplay experience.

So far so good. I love this game and the app version is true to the physical one. Just a few minor issues with tap range on the phone sized game when using certain actions. The play is smooth, the only feature I'd request is an option to speed up the computer opponents even more.
Very cool game with lots of replayability due to the number of projects and strategies. The text is a little small but it's not a problem for me on my Pixel 3XL. It also has a challenging solo mode.

Great game with a few minor issues. - Some animations (like the player turn animation) are not affected by the speed setting which is aggravating, a lot of time is wasted looking at animations - When viewing a cards details and you go back to your hand, it goes back to the first page of cards and not the page you were on. So if you look at card 20 and go back to your hand, you have to scroll all the way back to the right - Needs the xpacs!
Excellent adaptation and mobile port of an excellent game

Good representation of the board game. Includes nice animations and prompts to ease the understanding of the flow of the game. Screen goes to sleep during long animations however and there is no in game option to turn off the screen sleep.

Great game but if you close the app you lose your progress. Minimizing or switching to another app is fine, but closing the app by mistake throws away your game. Others mention lack of ability to see cards before choosing your corporation, but there's a button to change your corporation after you see your cards.
Games in progress disappear. The game play is really great overall, but I've had two in progress local games disappear and not be available to resume.
